lead_paragraph: Celtic and A.C. Milan reached the second round of the Champions League yesterday, joining six other clubs that have qualified. Celtic reached the knockout round for the first time, beating Manchester United, 1-0, on a curving free kick in the 81st minute from the Japanese winger Shunsuke Nakamura. Louis Saha had a chance to tie the score for United in the 90th minute, but goalkeeper Artur Boruc made the save diving to his right. The six-time champion A.C. Milan lost by 1-0 at AEK Athens, but advanced with one of the two spots from Group H.
